#Text=4. Simulation Results and Discussion

#Text=In this section , the performance of the proposed scheme is investigated against several non-ideal channel conditions such as frequency offset , phase offset , timing offset , varying symbol number as well as different Doppler shifts .
#Text=An analytical comparison is also provided with previously proposed different learning-based modulation classifiers .
#Text=4.1. Dataset
#Text=In this paper , the following modulation schemes were considered .
#Text=The transmitted bit-stream was generated randomly to ensure each has equal probability .
#Text=The received signal was pre-processed at the receiver end to obtain a complex based-band signal .

#Text=The In-Phase-Quadrature ( I-Q ) samples of the received signal were sampled simultaneously to a frame of length N. They are combined later in a 2 X N matrix and input to CNN for feature extraction .
#Text=In this study , the value of N is 2048 but some experiments are performed with N = 1024 , 512 .
#Text=This is done by varying the number of symbols in the frame .
#Text=A segment has the same results as that of a full observation .
#Text=In this way , the proposed classifier would be independent of N. The range of AWGN noise with signal-to-noise ratio ( SNR ) = âˆ’8 dB to +8 dB in the dataset .
#Text=For each modulation scheme and SNR values , 10,000 realizations of the received signal are generated according to the model described in Section 2 .
#Text=The rest of the parameters are summarized in Table 1 in detail .
#Text=4.2. Training and Validation Performance
#Text=In the following experiment , the proposed classifier NSVM , which is a hybrid combination of CNN and SVM is trained and validated by using offline deployment .
#Text=In order to analyze the performance , the accuracy and loss curves of training and cross-validation are plotted in
#Text=Figure 5
#Text=.
#Text=Similar experiments are performed with a traditional CNN model with the softmax classifier in its last layer , and the results are plotted in
#Text=Figure 6
#Text=.
#Text=The CNN settings used here are the same in both cases , as shown in
#Text=Figure 4
#Text=, expect one is trained with Gaussian SVM and the other one is trained with softmax as the decision classifier .
#Text=The performance of NSVM is better than the traditional CNN model as the accuracy and loss converges to their minima and maxima quickly .
#Text=Along with that , these results show that it smoothens as training progresses , which shows the effectiveness of the proposed scheme .
#Text=This also reduces the cost of training for the proposed model .
#Text=However , in the case of CNN with softmax , the classifier performance is hardly stable and satisfactory , as can be seen in
#Text=Figure 6
#Text=.
